div1.head: Jim to Mon. Paul Rockwell June 27th ‘15
div1.p: I wrote you a letter to go in by staff car, and then sent a note via military post yesterday. The staff car hasn’t shown up yet but when it does I’ll send this and the long letter sent Chez M. le V___ by it. I have just received your welcome long letter and am adding a couple of things to my other communication. First let me thank you for scaring up the photos. I must owe you quite a bit on the photo end, so please let me know the amount and I’ll remit while the remitting is good. I’m anxious to see the enlargement of the one showing you and myself.

Yes, as I said in my other letter I [‘wrote’ scratched out] ^heard from the Vicomte. Please let me know if he got my letter. I’m very pleased about what you tell me concerning his interest in me. It certainly was damn nice of
him to write to me, or to concern himself about me at all for that matter.

Its great that Kiffin’s getting on so well. In one way its rough for it will mean his return the sooner. God knows he’s done ten times his share and then some and I should think they would insist on his going in some branch that didn’t have all the odds against one.

So you’re not going to be able to plan until August? Well that isn’t far off you know and besides what the devil difference do a couple of months make in the long run. I hope they pronounce you a hopeless reforme so you can’t go out and risk your old neck again. I’d hate like hell to see you go. You may not know it but I haven’t a friend in the world I like better than you and am damn glad to have you say you find me a good
pal ~ Eh Mon vieux. By the way where in the name of Allah did you scare up a G.N.E. pin in Paris. The old outfit must have an international rep. Must look funny to see Jeanne (You don’t mind my referring to her that way in letters do you?) who is French sporting a frat pin around.

We’ve been having it too quiet around here of late. Its about the safest place in creation for the last few days. The Germans have been bombarding the 1st & 2nd & 3rd line trenches with 210s a great deal, however, and the position is very uncomfortable. The French batteries have been silent and they’re
not firing on them. Its all hard to understand. A fellow I brought down to day told me he’d been at the Marne, in Ypres and other places but had never seen such hot shelling before. We’ve had no attacks in a long time either. Tho [sic] we are all up along the line just back of the trenches we can’t hear much on account of the lay of the land when it comes from the Boches.

Sure, I don’t mind about the publicity. Bull em [sic] along if you want to, but don’t give away any stuff that the French might complain about my having told. My reputation being in shreds, it can’t be hurt. Would like to see a copy of the item if possible.[?]
